str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
A gate. Apparently a primary word; a gate, i.e. The leaf or wing of a folding entrance.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To die, be dying, be dead. A strengthened form of a simpler primary thano than'-o; to die.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To carry out (of the city gate for burial). From ek and komizo; to bear forth.
Only, only-begotten; unique. From monos and ginomai; only-born, i.e. Sole.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
